chunks.text: ### Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme
chunks.summary: This scheme applies to sponsors and Ukrainian guests participating in the Homes for Ukraine program. Sponsors must provide suitable accommodation and ensure compliance with UK immigration laws, with specific eligibility and safeguarding requirements; exceptions or thresholds are outlined for certain circumstances.

### Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 11.1. A person applying for entry clearance under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form: “Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme”.

1.   UKR 11.2. An application for entry clearance under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must be outside the UK on the date of application: and
    4.   (d) the applicant must have provided the name of a UK sponsor who has offered them accommodation in the UK.

1.   UKR 11.3. If the applicant is aged under 18 on the date of application they must either: 
    1.   (a) be applying with, or to join in the UK, their parent or legal guardian; or
    2.   (b) their sponsor must have been approved as a sponsor for that applicant under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme under the guidance: “Homes for Ukraine - Applications to Homes for Ukraine for children who are not travelling or reuniting with their parent or legal guardian: Guidance for Councils” before the date of application and the applicant must provide evidence of that approval in the form of a reference number.

1.   UKR 11.3A. If an application for entry clearance under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme is varied to permission to stay under paragraph UKR 14.1, the applicant must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) they must have provided biometrics when required; and
    2.   (b) they must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality; and
    3.   (c) they must be in the UK on the date of application.

1.   UKR 11.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must apply online, provide biometric and identity documents, be outside the UK, and name a UK sponsor. Applicants under 18 must be accompanied by or joining a parent/guardian or have prior sponsor approval with evidence; exceptions are limited to specific guardianship arrangements.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 12.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under any of the following paragraphs of Part Suitability: 
    1.   (a) SUI 2.1. to SUI 2.2. (exclusion or deportation orders); or
    2.   (b) SUI 3.1. to SUI 3.2. (non-conducive); or
    3.   (c) SUI 4.1. to SUI 4.2. (exclusion from asylum or humanitarian protection); or
    4.   (d) SUI 5.1. to SUI 5.5. (criminality); or
    5.   (e) SUI 8.1. to SUI 8.2. (involvement in sham marriage or sham civil partnership); or
    6.   (f) SUI 9.1., SUI 10.1. and SUI 10.2. (false representations and deception); or
    7.   (g) SUI 11.1. to SUI 11.8. (previous breach of immigration laws); or
    8.   (h) SUI 14.1. to SUI 14.2. (failure to provide required information); or
    9.   (i) SUI 15.1. to SUI 15.2. (admissibility to the Common Travel Area or other countries); or
    10.   (j) SUI 20.1. to SUI 25.2. and SUI 28.1. to SUI 30.1. (grounds for refusal and cancellation on arrival).
chunks.summary: Applicants for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must not be excluded under specified suitability grounds, including criminality, false representations, previous breaches of immigration laws, or involvement in sham arrangements. They must meet these conditions to be eligible, with certain thresholds and conditions outlined in the relevant paragraphs.

metadata.section_title: Approved sponsor requirement for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Approved sponsor requirement for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 15.1. An applicant under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must have an Approved sponsor under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme.

1.   UKR 15.2. If a family group is applying under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme, the Ukrainian national and their immediate family members (meaning an individual set out in UKR 18.1.) must have the same Approved sponsor under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme.

1.   UKR 15.2A. If the applicant is a child on the date of application: 
    1.   (a) they must be applying with, or to join in the UK, their parent or legal guardian; or
    2.   (b) their sponsor must have been approved as a sponsor for that applicant under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme under the guidance: “Homes for Ukraine - Applications to Homes for Ukraine for children who are not travelling or reuniting with their parent or legal guardian: Guidance for Councils” before the date of application and the applicant must provide evidence of that approval in the form of a reference number.

1.   UKR 15.3. If the applicant is a child, the Approved sponsor must not previously have failed to meet the requirements for approval as a sponsor under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme under the guidance: “Homes for Ukraine - Applications to Homes for Ukraine for children who are not travelling or reuniting with their parent or legal guardian: Guidance for Councils”.

1.   UKR 15.4. If a child is not applying with or to join their parent or legal guardian, but they are applying with or to join an adult relative (meaning a grandparent, uncle, aunt or sibling aged 18 or older) who qualifies under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme, the child and the adult relative must have the same Approved sponsor.
chunks.summary: Applicants under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must have an Approved sponsor, with family groups sharing the same sponsor. For child applicants, prior sponsor approval or parental/jurisdictional connection is required; sponsors must also meet all approval criteria. Exceptions apply for children joining or reuniting with a parent or guardian, provided evidence of prior approval is supplied.

metadata.section_title: Residence requirement for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Residence requirement for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 16.1. An applicant applying for entry clearance under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must have been ordinarily resident in Ukraine immediately before 1 January 2022, unless they are a child born on or after that date.
chunks.summary: Applicants under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme must have been ordinarily resident in Ukraine immediately before 1 January 2022, unless they are children born on or after that date.

metadata.section_title: Nationality requirement for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Nationality requirement for the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 17.1. The applicant must be either: 
    1.   (a) a Ukrainian national; or
    2.   (b) part of an immediate family group (meaning the group set out in UKR 18.1.) which includes an immediate family member who is a Ukrainian national who has been granted under or is applying under and qualifies under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme.

The scheme applies specifically to Ukrainian nationals or their immediate family members meeting these criteria.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for a family member under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for a family member under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 18.1. If the applicant is not a Ukrainian national, they must be the immediate family member of a Ukrainian national who has been granted under or is applying under and qualifies under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme, meaning a: 
    1.   (a) partner of the Ukrainian national; or
    2.   (b) child aged under 18 on the date of application of the Ukrainian national or of their partner; or
    3.   (c) parent of a Ukrainian national child aged under 18 on the date of application (if the child is applying under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme); or
    4.   (d) fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner of the Ukrainian national.

1.   UKR 18.2. If applying as a partner, fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner, the applicant must be in a genuine and subsisting relationship with the Ukrainian national which commenced before 1 January 2022.

1.   UKR 18.3. If applying as a partner, the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.
chunks.summary: Applicants must be immediate family members or partners of Ukrainian nationals under the scheme, with partners' relationships starting before 1 January 2022 and meeting specific relationship criteria; exceptions apply for children and proposed civil partners.

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for a child applying to join a parent or legal guardian in the UK under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for a child applying to join a parent or legal guardian in the UK under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

UKR 19A.1. If the applicant is aged under 18 on the date of application and they are joining (and not accompanying) a parent or legal guardian in the UK, they must have written consent from the parent or legal guardian in the UK who they are joining, unless the decision maker is satisfied it is reasonable in the circumstances to grant the child entry clearance without that consent.

1.   UKR 19A.2 The written consent must confirm all of the following: 
    1.   (a) support for the application; and
    2.   (b) that the applicant will live with the parent or legal guardian in the UK; and
    3.   (c) that the parent or legal guardian has permission to stay in the UK; and
    4.   (d) the applicant’s travel to, and reception arrangements in, the UK.
chunks.summary: Applicants under 18 seeking to join a parent or guardian under the Homes for Ukraine Scheme must provide written parental consent confirming support, residence plans, and transfer arrangements, unless the applicant can demonstrate that granting entry without consent is reasonable.

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for a child applying without their parent or legal guardian

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for a child applying without their parent or legal guardian

1.   UKR 19B.1. If a child is not applying with, or to join in the UK, a parent or legal guardian the applicant must have provided written consent from a parent or legal guardian to the child coming to live in the UK with the named sponsor (who was approved under UKR 11.3(b)) and any adult relative who is applying with the child. The consent must be signed by at least one parent or the child’s legal guardian, and notarised or approved by: 
    1.   (a) the notary authorities or Guardianship service of the city/regional council in Ukraine; or
    2.   (b) if the applicant is outside Ukraine, notary authorities in the country the applicant is residing in or a Ukrainian Embassy or Consulate.

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme

1.   UKR 19.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements under the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.

metadata.section_title: Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text: ### Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme
chunks.summary: The Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme applies to Ukrainian nationals with existing permissions. Applicants must demonstrate continued eligibility and meet specified conditions to extend their stay. Extensions are subject to compliance with scheme rules and any specified thresholds or exceptions.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme
Topic: leave-to-remain

Summary: The Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme applies to Ukrainian nationals with existing permissions. Applicants must demonstrate continued eligibility and meet specified conditions to extend their stay. Extensions are subject to compliance with scheme rules and any specified thresholds or exceptions.

### Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

UKR 29.1. A person applying for permission to stay under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme.

1.   UKR 29.2. An application for permission to stay under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) it has not been made more than 28 days before expiry of the applicant’s current permission; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily established their identity and nationality and
    4.   (d) the applicant must be in the UK on the date of application.

1.   UKR 29.3. The applicant must have been granted permission in the UK or Islands: 
    1.   (a) under Appendix Ukraine Scheme, or the equivalent permission granted in the Islands; or
    2.   (b) outside the rules on or between 20 February 2022 and 2 May 2022, on the basis that the applicant would have been granted permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme had those rules been in force at that date; or
    3.   (c) outside the rules as a person who is: 
        1.   i) a Ukrainian national, or their family member as defined by section 8(3) of the Immigration Act 1971; and
        2.   ii) was in the UK and exempt from immigration control in accordance with the Immigration Act 1971 between 18 March 2022 and 16 November 2023; and
        3.   iii) would have met the requirements of Appendix Ukraine Scheme if they had ceased to be exempt from immigration control between 18 March 2022 and 16 November 2023; and
        4.   iv) ceased being exempt from immigration control between 16 November 2023 and 4 February 2025; or
        5.   v) a family member who does not meet the conditions of section 8(3) of the Immigration Act 1971, of a Ukrainian national who would have met the requirements to act as a sponsor under the Ukraine Family Scheme on or before 15:00 GMT 19 February 2024 had they (the Ukrainian national) not been exempt from immigration control in accordance with the Immigration Act 1971 at that time; or
        6.   vi) a member of a group who was transferred to the UK between 14 February 2022 to 30 March 2022 inclusive in order to facilitate their relocation from Dnipro as a result of a specific agreement with the Ukrainian Government; or
        7.   vii) a person who was admitted to the UK for the purposes of urgent medical treatment in the UK following agreement about such treatment with the Department of Health and Social Care in their particular case; or
        8.   viii) the parent or carer of a child who meets the conditions of UKR 29.3(c)(vi) or UKR 29.3(c)(vii), or
        9.   ix) a child who made a Homes for Ukraine Scheme application before 10 August 2022 and met the requirements for the concession to Appendix Ukraine Scheme as set out in the Homes for Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme guidance from 15 July 2022; or

    4.   (x) a child who was granted permission to enter the UK prior to 31 January 2025 on the basis that they had a parent who held permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme, or the equivalent permission granted in the Islands, or in accordance with the provisions set out at UKR 29.3(b).

UKR 29.4. UKR 29.3 does not apply if the applicant is a child who was born in the UK or Islands after 18 March 2022 to a Ukrainian national parent who was granted permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme or the equivalent permission in the Islands.

UKR 29.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme must apply online within 28 days of expiry, providing biometrics and valid identity documents while being in the UK. They must have previously held permission granted under the scheme, in the Islands, or during specified dates from 2022, and be Ukrainian nationals or their family members exempt from immigration control.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 30.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under any of the following paragraphs of Part Suitability: 
    1.   (a) SUI 2.1. to SUI 2.2. (exclusion or deportation orders); or
    2.   (b) SUI 3.1. to SUI 3.2. (non-conducive); or
    3.   (c) SUI 4.1. to SUI 4.2. (exclusion from asylum or humanitarian protection); or
    4.   (d) SUI 5.1. to SUI 5.5. (criminality); or
    5.   (e) SUI 8.1. to SUI 8.2. (involvement in sham marriage or sham civil partnership); or
    6.   (f) SUI 9.1., SUI 10.1. and SUI 10.2. (false representations and deception); or
    7.   (g) SUI 11.1. to SUI 11.8. (previous breach of immigration laws); or
    8.   (h) SUI 14.1. to SUI 14.2. (failure to provide required information); or
    9.   (i) SUI 15.1. to SUI 15.2. (admissibility to the Common Travel Area or other countries); or
    10.   (j) SUI 20.1. to SUI 25.2. and SUI 28.1. to 30.1. (grounds for refusal and cancellation on arrival).

UKR 30.2. A period of overstaying will be disregarded for the purpose of Part Suitability if the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking the Ukraine Permission Extension must not be subject to refusal reasons listed in Part Suitability, covering criminality, deception, breach of immigration laws, and related grounds. Overstaying is disregarded if certain exceptions for overstayers apply, subject to specific conditions.

### Suitability requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 30.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under any of the following paragraphs of Part Suitability: 
    1.   (a) SUI 2.1. to SUI 2.2. (exclusion or deportation orders); or
    2.   (b) SUI 3.1. to SUI 3.2. (non-conducive); or
    3.   (c) SUI 4.1. to SUI 4.2. (exclusion from asylum or humanitarian protection); or
    4.   (d) SUI 5.1. to SUI 5.5. (criminality); or
    5.   (e) SUI 8.1. to SUI 8.2. (involvement in sham marriage or sham civil partnership); or
    6.   (f) SUI 9.1., SUI 10.1. and SUI 10.2. (false representations and deception); or
    7.   (g) SUI 11.1. to SUI 11.8. (previous breach of immigration laws); or
    8.   (h) SUI 14.1. to SUI 14.2. (failure to provide required information); or
    9.   (i) SUI 15.1. to SUI 15.2. (admissibility to the Common Travel Area or other countries); or
    10.   (j) SUI 20.1. to SUI 25.2. and SUI 28.1. to 30.1. (grounds for refusal and cancellation on arrival).

UKR 30.2. A period of overstaying will be disregarded for the purpose of Part Suitability if the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies.

metadata.section_id: Eligibility requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme
chunks.summary: The scheme applies to Ukrainian nationals granted permission under the Ukraine Permission Extension. Applicants must meet specific eligibility criteria, including continuous residence and character requirements, with certain exceptions, to qualify for an extension.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Ukraine Scheme
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Ukraine Scheme
Section ID: Eligibility requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme
Section: Eligibility requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme
Topic: eligibility

Summary: The scheme applies to Ukrainian nationals granted permission under the Ukraine Permission Extension. Applicants must meet specific eligibility criteria, including continuous residence and character requirements, with certain exceptions, to qualify for an extension.

### Eligibility requirements for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

metadata.section_title: Nationality requirement for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Nationality requirement for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 31.1. The applicant must be either: 
    1.   (a) a Ukrainian national who has previously been granted permission in accordance with UKR 29.3; or
    2.   (b) if not a Ukrainian national, an individual who was granted permission in accordance with UKR 29.3, as, and who remains: 
        1.   (i) the partner of a Ukrainian national; or
        2.   (ii) the child of a Ukrainian national; or
        3.   (iii) the parent of a Ukrainian national who was granted Ukraine Scheme permission before they turned 18 years old; or
        4.   (iv) the fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner of a Ukrainian national; or
        5.   (v) a family member granted in accordance with the rules at the time in Appendix Ukraine Scheme on the now closed Ukraine Family Scheme; or
        6.   (vi) a carer of a child who meets the conditions at UKR 29.3(c)(vi) or UKR 29.3(c)(vii); or

    3.   (c) an individual who is the parent of a child who: 
        1.   (i) was born in the UK or Islands and is in the UK or Islands with permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme or the equivalent permission in the Islands; or
        2.   (ii) was born in the UK or Islands and meets the criteria at UKR 29.4 and who would, if they made an application, be eligible for permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme; or

    4.   (d) a child who was born in the UK or Islands after 18 March 2022 to a Ukrainian national parent.

UKR 31.2. A child born in the UK or Islands must provide a full UK birth certificate showing the names of their parent(s).

UKR 31.3. For the purpose of the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme “parent” does not include a step-parent unless they are the legal or adoptive parent of the child.
chunks.summary: The provision applies to applicants under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme, including Ukrainian nationals and certain family members. They must have prior permission under UKR 29.3 and meet specific relationship or birth criteria, particularly relating to UK or Islands residency post-18 March 2022. Exceptions include children of Ukrainian nationals born in the UK or Islands after this date.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirement for a partner or parent under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirement for a partner or parent under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 32.1. If the applicant previously qualified for Ukraine Scheme permission, or permission outside the rules in accordance with UKR 29.3(b) or 29.3(c), based on their relationship as the non-Ukrainian partner of a Ukrainian national, they must either: 
    1.   (a) continue to be in a relationship with a Ukrainian national who has, or previously had permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme, and the requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met; or
    2.   (b) be the parent or legal guardian of a child who is in the UK with permission, under Appendix Ukraine Scheme, or a child who meets the criteria at UKR 29.4 and who would, if they made an application, be eligible for permission under this Appendix.

UKR 32.2. To meet the requirements of UKR 32.1(b) as a parent, a birth certificate showing the names of the child’s parent(s) must be provided.

UKR 32.3. To meet the requirements of UKR 32.1(b) as a legal guardian, a court order or government issued document naming the applicant as the legal guardian of the child must be provided.

UKR 32.4. If an applicant cannot provide the required documents set out in UKR 32.2 or UKR 32.3, other evidence demonstrating that they are the parent or legal guardian of the child may be considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners and parents under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme. They must maintain their relationship with a Ukrainian national or be a parent/legal guardian of a relevant child, providing necessary proof such as birth certificates or court orders, with flexibility for alternative evidence if documents are unavailable.

metadata.section_title: Residence requirement for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Residence requirement for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 33.1. An application may be refused if the applicant has not been living in the UK and Islands since they: 
    1.   (a) arrived in the UK with permission in accordance with UKR 29.3; or
    2.   (b) were granted permission in accordance with UKR 29.3 in the UK; or
    3.   (c) were born in the UK or Islands pursuant to UKR 31.1(d) to a Ukrainian national parent with permission under UKR 29.3(a).

UKR 33.2. Temporary periods spent in Ukraine will not be regarded as living outside of the UK and Islands for the purpose of UKR 33.1.

UKR 33.3. Temporary periods spent outside the UK and Islands or Ukraine may not be regarded as living outside of the UK and Islands for the purpose of UKR 33.1 if an applicant can demonstrate ongoing ties to the UK which require a grant of further permission.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking to extend their Ukraine Permission under the UK Immigration Rules. It requires applicants to have resided in the UK and Islands since their arrival or birth under specified permissions, with temporary absences in Ukraine not counting as residence, unless ongoing UK ties demonstrate the need for continued permission.

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for a child applying under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for a child applying under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 34.1. If the applicant is aged under 18 years on the date of application and they will not be living with their parent or legal guardian, they must have written consent from: 
    1.   (a) both parents; or
    2.   (b) one parent, if that parent has sole legal responsibility for the applicant; or
    3.   (c) the applicant’s legal guardian,

2.   unless the decision maker is satisfied it is reasonable in the circumstances to grant the child permission without such written consent.

1.   UKR 34.2. The written consent must provide contact details of the parent(s) or legal guardian and confirm consent is given for both of the following: 
    1.   (a) the application; and
    2.   (b) the applicant’s living and care arrangements in the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants under 18 applying for UK immigration under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme. They must have written parental or guardian consent if not living with them, unless the decision maker deems it reasonable to waive this requirement; consent must include contact details and cover both the application and care arrangements.

metadata.section_title: Care requirement for a child applying under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Care requirement for a child applying under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

UKR 35.1. If the applicant is aged under 18 years on the date of application, there must be suitable arrangements for the child’s care and accommodation in the UK, which must comply with relevant UK legislation and regulations.
chunks.summary: Applicants under 18 applying under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme must have suitable care and accommodation arrangements in the UK, compliant with UK laws. This requirement ensures the child's welfare, with no specified exceptions.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

UKR 36.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.
chunks.summary: Applicants under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme will be granted or refused based on whether they meet all suitability and eligibility requirements; failure to do so results in refusal.

### Decision on an application under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

UKR 36.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Period of grant for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 37.1. The applicant will be granted permission to stay for whichever is the shorter of either: 
    1.   (a) 18 months; or
    2.   (b) a period which would mean the applicant has been granted a maximum of 18 months under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme, except if any of the following apply: 
        1.   (i) if the applicant is a child whose parent or legal guardian qualifies under UKR 31.1 and is granted permission at the same time as the applicant, the applicant will be granted permission in line with that parent or legal guardian; or
        2.   (ii) if the applicant is a child whose parent or legal guardian has permission under Appendix Ukraine Scheme and is in the UK the applicant will be granted permission in line with that parent; or
        3.   (iii) if the applicant is a child where both parents are in the UK and either qualify under UKR 31.1 and are granted permission at the same time as the applicant or have permission granted under Appendix Ukraine Scheme the applicant will be granted permission in line with the parent whose permission expires last.
chunks.summary: The scheme applies to applicants under the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme, granting permission for up to 18 months or until cumulative maximums are reached. Exceptions apply to children whose guardians or parents are also under the scheme, with permissions aligned to those of the qualifying parent or guardian.

metadata.section_title: Conditions of grant for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

chunks.text:
### Conditions of grant for the Ukraine Permission Extension Scheme

1.   UKR 38.1. The grant will be subject to all the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) access to public funds permitted; and
    2.   (b) work (including self-employment and voluntary work) permitted; and
    3.   (c) study permitted, subject to the Academic Technology Approval Scheme (ATAS) condition in Appendix ATAS.

Print this page
